semantics.accomplishment: Designed pure function multiply with TypeScript-first approach, three core decisions on implementation style, type safety, and edge case handling
semantics.keyInsight: TypeScript compile-time safety eliminates need for runtime validation, enabling clean function signature and native JavaScript behavior pass-through

decisions.why: Enables tree-shaking, simple testing, explicit dependencies, no state mutation
Type erasure at runtime simplifies implementation, leverages TS compiler for safety without runtime overhead
Avoids custom edge case handling, reduces complexity, users get expected JS semantics

challenges.what: TypeScript type safety without runtime guards
challenges.resolution: Trust compiler for type safety; document edge cases for users

risks.description: Floating point arithmetic precision loss in JavaScript
risks.mitigation: Document limitation; users apply precision checks if needed
Native JS behavior; users aware via documentation

approaches.rationale: Modern ES module standard, better than default exports for discoverability
Minimal surface area, clear intent, easy to test

handoff.readyFor: Implementation - create pure multiply function with named export, TypeScript types, no runtime validation
handoff.context: Architecture: pure function, no class-based approach. Type safety via TypeScript compiler only. Pass through native JS behavior for edge cases (Infinity, NaN, precision).
